reference.title: serviced host
reference.shortdesc: The serviced host command administers host data.

refbody.section:
COMMANDSThe following commands are available for serviced host:
list Lists all hosts.
add Adds a host.
If the host is behind a router or firewall for network address translation (NAT), include the option --nat-address to specify the device host name or IP address and port of the delegate host.
remove, rm Removes a host.
register Sets the authentication keys to use for a host. When KEYSFILE is -, keys are read from standard input (stdin).
set-memory Sets the memory allocation for a specific host.
help, h Shows a list of commands or the help for a single command.
